headline: Zucchini-Chocolate Chip Muffins
description: These tender zucchini muffins are packed with shredded zucchini, chocolate chips, and walnuts. They're a feel-good breakfast, dessert, or on-the-go snack.

video.description: Try these delicious zucchini muffins studded with chocolate chips.
video.name: Zucchini-Chocolate Chip Muffins

name: Zucchini-Chocolate Chip Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups, or line with paper muffin liners.

Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl. Mix egg, oil, milk, lemon juice, and vanilla extract in a bowl. Stir wet ingredients into dry ingredients until just moistened. Fold in zucchini, chocolate chips, and walnuts.
Fill prepared muffin cups 2/3 full with batter.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: AMAZING. I didn't have a egg, added flax, a dash of orange juice, water instead of milk and olive oil. Still turned out incredible!!!! Probably some of the best muffins I've ever had.

These muffins are amazing!!! I made these changes: substituted flour with 1 cup Krusteaz gluten free flour and a 1/2 cup almond flour; substituted vegetable oil with 1/4 cup melted coconut oil and 1/4 apple sauce; substituted sugar with 1/2 cup swerve sugar substitute; substituted milk with almond milk . Increased cinnamon a bit. Love these so much!!!
Great recipe. Helped use up left over zucchini. I subbed for Gluten Free flour and it worked a treat! Yay

I live at 6000 feet, so I added 8 1/2 tbs to the liquid, added a bit more flour and used mostly oat flour, decreased the baking soda by half, decreased the sugar to 1/2 yellow sugar, increased oven heat a bit, and baked for 18 min. I replace the vegetable oil with a mix of butter, coco oil, and yogourt.
Very moist and yummy. I cut the sugar in half and it's still plenty sweet for us.
I thought these muffins were really yummy. I didn’t have lemon juice or nuts so wasn’t able to add that in but otherwise followed the recipe. Thank you!

Quite tasty, but I made a few changes - 1) I used 1/2 and 1/2 since I had some that had to be used up. 2) I used only 1/4 C oil and 1/4 C applesauce. 3) I used less sugar, only 1/2 C. The muffins were dense, but still tasted great. I couldn't give 5 stars since I switched up ingredients
Very easy. I didn’t measure the zucchini, looked like a bit more than a cup, and I used regular chocolate chips and a full cup. Moist and delicious!
These muffins were perfect. I made no changes.
Followed recipe exactly but baked in a loaf pan at 325 for 55 minutes. (Convection oven) Perfect! Got excellent reviews from the recipients of this loaf. Thanks to the contributor.
These are great muffins! I added a little nutmeg and a bit more cinnamon. I served them to friends and family and they loved them.
i love this recipie! ive been using it for around a year and people always compliment them. personally i use applesauce instead of oil and it still turns out great! :-)
Instead of using oil l replaced it with apple sauce. Next time l will use natural flour. Other than that they came out delicious. 😋🤤
These were delicious and very tender. I am going to make there again to share with my friends, thank you.
These were absolutely delicious! I didn’t change the recipe at all and loved them.
I triple this recipe leaving out the nuts and they are so good!

This was the perfect recipe for using my extra summer zucchini. In an attempt to be healthy, I substituted applesauce for oil and used only a 1/2 c of sugar. I also substituted about a tablespoon of sour cream for the equivalent of milk, for moisture. The muffins turned out great! They were slightly sweet and moist. My kids loved them.
Excellent! Followed recipe exactly, what a hit these were. Moist and delicious. Baked at 350 for 20 minutes.

Awesome recipe. Made it exactly as the recipe specified and even my pickiest child loved them! Coming back after making this recipe for several years to add that my kids still ask for these muffins. I tend to reduce the amount of cinnamon slightly and substitute applesauce for the oil. Great recipe!

Best dang muffins this side of heaven. I knew I was going to double it so I made 2 batches to try it with and without applesauce substitute. Both turned out great, in fact all my family preferred the batch made with 1/4 c applesauce and 1/4 c oil instead of 1/2 c oil. I will make these all summer long!
I didn't have vanilla extract, so used almond to substitute. This recipe is fantastic! The muffins are fluffy and delicious. Highly recommend!!
I followed the recipe & it was perfect. I have to do this again because I have a lot of zucchini from my garden.
Added extra zucchini because I have an abundance.
The only thing I would change in this recipe is to add more chocolate chips! If you're using a regular cupcake size pan like me, it took 24 minutes to bake.
I premade some for a camping trip for a grab-n-go snacks for the kids. Gone! Has anyone tried coconut oil and sugar instead white sugar and vegetable oil?

My new favorite muffins! I made these gluten free and subbed the flour for Bobs Red Mill one to one. I did 1/2 c sugar and instead of 1/2 c oil I did 1/4 c oil and 1/4 c of a baby pouch that had spinach, pear, and blueberry. It was delicious!
Definitely a favorite with my kids and a fantastic use of extra zucchini!

I love this recipe so much. The muffins are so very tasty. My 11 year old stepdaughter asks for these every other week when she comes for the weekend and she barely eats anything!! Big compliment to this chef! I'm about to whip out another batch today,!!!
I didn’t add chocolate chips cause I made it for my 1 year old and but the kids loved it, my hubby refused to try it till he smelt it baking lol 😂 then he said he would try the green boogers
Very dry and I followed the recipe to a tee (used measuring cups etc). Maybe I should have added applesauce like others wrote. Bland taste too. Do not recommend.

Great recipe. 
I used mostly unsweetened applesauce instead of oil, 1/3 cup sugar and added a bit more zucchini
I loved these muffins, I added 70% dark chocolate chunks instead of the mini chips.

Great taste!
Substituted 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce for the oil.
Great recipe, I made it exactly as written, the muffins were delicious
These are amazing, I made a batch and they were gone almost instantly so I made another but with butterscotch chips. Just as good! Keeper for sure.
I used half gluten free all purpose flour/ half coconut flour and I substituted the sugar for coconut sugar. They came out amazing! Can't wait to make again.

This was my first time ever using Zucchini. This recipe is awesome. I did use an all purpose Gluten Free flour in place of the regular flour. I also used a commercial egg replacer. I did add 1tbsp of cocoa powder. My kids were extremely skeptical and I convinced them to try one. 10 minutes later and they have helped themselves to quite a few! I will be making this again!
I doubled the recipe and used pecans instead of walnuts - still super yummy!
these muffins were so moist and delicious. I omitted the walnuts, but otherwise made no changes.

These were delicious! I always take a recipe and try to figure out how to make it healthier. I used whole wheat flour instead of all purpose. I used puréed pumpkin instead of oil and monk fruit instead of sugar. Since we have an abundance of zucchini, I will be making these again.
this was delicious! I ran out of sugar so I substituted half cup of honey. perfection.
Perfect recipe as is!! Made a double batch to freeze some. Yummy!
I made it exactly as written and they turned out delicious. I immediately made a second batch.

I made this with almond milk and dairy-free choc-chips. Also subbed lime for lemon juice just because that is what I had but I've also made them with lemon juice before. They turned out perfectly, this recipe is a keeper.

Something felt missing from this, The zucchini over powered everything.. tasted like a “very” healthy muffin lol.. I added more sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and all spice. Topped with butter and rolled in cinnamon sugar. Now tastes great, very moist!!

I just made this recipe while camping. Wanted to try out my camper oven! They delicious and very moist!! Since we are diabetic here I used brown sugar Splenda instead of sugar to cut back on sweetness. However, i still used the chocolate chips!!! I had made a bit extra so I could make a small cake as well. We really like them. Thank you for delicious recipe
Turns out great! Instead of 1/2 c vegetable oil, I use 1/4 vegetable oil and 1/4 c apple sauce (all apple
Yum! I loved these and so did my family! Followed the recipe exactly and they have the perfect crunch from the walnuts and the flavor is perfect. Will be making these again!
Absolutely fantastic! I reduced sugar as someone suggested. Drained zucchini. Super moist and chocolatey. Total hit!

These were delicious! I replaced half a cup with whole wheat flour, put in about a quarter of a cup of flaxseed, and replaced half of the sugar with applesauce; I mixed the applesauce with the wet ingredients. I also grated the zucchini on the fine grate so that it would almost disappear into the muffin. My daughter love them! They were moist, soft, and sweet.

Thank you for this recipe! I used 1 cup white, 1/2 cup whole wheat flour, 1/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce, 1/2 cup sugar and white chocolate chips. The muffins rose well, looked and tasted amazing! Very light and moist, too.

This turned out amazing!! Although i could not make zucchini muffins because I did not have zucchini, these chocolate chip muffins came out great! They do become very hard after a day so I think next time will bake it for less time!
Great Recipe! Very moist and yummy. My husband couldn't stop eating them. Lol
great! but only yield 6 muffins. I wonder if the original 12 was for cupcakes tins.
Super moist!

These turned out great! I only had regular chocolate chips, and I think I preferred that to the mini chocolate chips. Also I finished off my buttermilk, replacing regular milk. The grandkids loved them and my farmer husband snacked on them in the combine during harvest. A great recipe!
Perfect just as it’s written. No need to make changes!
love it

Made these to the recipe! Fabulous! (I only had cupcake sized papers, so made do with those)... Boyfriend's new favorite! ?? So easy to make! Will definitely be a go-to in the future.. Thank you for sharing!
The second time Ive made them & theyre delicious. This time I added a tablespoon of cocoa & I love the results.

This recipe is amazing. I made a couple changes. Reduced veg oil to 1/3 c and used brown sugar and reduced to 1/2 c. Added a little more lemon juice and rind as well as added 3/4 TBSP Cacao Powder. Delicious.
These muffins are delicious. I followed the recipe exactly. I topped them with a walnut piece and sprinkled them with some brown sugar/cinnamon. The grandkids loved them!

So delicious! Didn’t have mini chocolate chips so I used regular and cut back a little on sugar and added a little more walnuts and we loved every bite! We grow zucchini in our garden and this was a very fun new way to enjoy it.
Amazing!

Excellent recipe. I used about 2 cups of zucchini...that’s what my one small/medium zucchini made when grated. I made as mini muffins and it made 48. Baked for about 14-15 min. A big hit with my grandparents!
I used lime juice and slivered almonds instead of lemon juice and walnuts as that’s what I had on hand and these turned out delicious! So moist and not too sweet.

These are delicious. My children LOVE them. I followed the recipe exactly with one exception — I ran out of vegetable oil so I split half vegetable oil, half canola oil. Will definitely make these again!
Love it! I added a little more chocolate chips to it, I used dark chocolate! My son could not tell it had zucchini in it, so thumbs up for sneaky healthy muffins for the kiddos! Will be making more.

I left out the walnuts (partially because I didn’t have any and partially because my kids don’t like nuts) and I think I could’ve used more zucchini but they turned out amazing! I didn’t have mini chocolate chips so I used regular and it was fine. I doubled the recipe and ended up being able to make 30 muffins instead of 24. Thank you for a great recipe!
I made the recipe as stated and came out very good, I got 25 muffins. I will make again.
My family lived these muffins. I switched out regular flour with gluten free measure for measure and they were so good. I will be freezing zucchini this fall to make these this winter.

Great recipe! I used finely chopped pecans instead of walnuts and just a little bit more cinnamon. Perfect! I also left the chocolate chips out of one muffin to test how it would taste as a plain zucchini muffin and it was spot on there too. Will definitely make again.
YUMM
I followed the recipe exactly. Perfect muffins!

I don't know what went wrong. I followed the recipe to a T but it didn't come out nowhere near how it should have. There was not enough moisture. It never "turned into batter". I was very disappointed.
This recipe is the easiest to prepare and the muffins are delicious! I didn’t substitute or add anything. It was perfect as is.

I followed all of the ingredients and measurements as is! I changed the walnuts to dried chopped prunes instead !
The muffins are super moist and perfect!
Simple, quick and delicious! I made these with frozen, shredded zucchini saved from the garden, so I had to microwave it to thaw it first and pour off the extra water.
Excellent recipe! I omitted the walnuts, just because I didn’t have any. Very easy, moist, sweet muffins.

Might have needed an altitude adjustment, I baked these at 6,200 feet, muffins had flat tops. Flavor was great but fragile texture, did not release from greased tin as easily as other muffins. No mini chocolate chips or walnuts on hand so I substituted regular chocolate chips, might have been a contributing factor. Tasted delicious, but fell apart easily.

We loved these! Always happy when I can find a pretty healthy snack option for the kids that is actually really good. I used 1/2 cup sugar and it was perfect for sweetness; also used half whole wheat flour. These will be a regular in our house from now on, thanks!!
Delicious! Made exactly as stated. I will experiment with different nuts I have on hand and possibly flax seed next time.

These turned out perfect. I will get rid of all my other similar recipes. I only used 1/4 cup walnuts. I made 20 mini-muffins and 4 large muffins with this recipe. I shared them with my neighbors during Covid Happy Hour in my driveway and they loved them!

We have a garden full of zucchini and decided these would be great to use some on, they definitely did not disappoint! Followed the recipe exactly and we got the most tasty, moist muffins! This was my first time making zucchini muffins and I was very pleased. Will make again using this recipe.

Best zucchini muffins! My 11 year made these all by herself.. didn’t have chocolate chips ..she sprinkled tops with cinnamon sugar before baking! I can’t take any credit .. hands down best I’ve ever had! She’s making more tomorrow!
Delicious...I didn’t have milk so I used half & half, used pecans instead of walnuts and milk chocolate chips instead of semisweet. Doubled the recipe and so glad that I did...these are amazing.
Perfect! I used dark chocolate chips because that is what I had on hand- otherwise I made it exactly as written. Thanks for sharing!
These muffins are delicious. I didn’t change a thing in the recipe. Very moist and not too sweet. I will definitely make these again.

It was very tasty even though I didn't put in chocolate chips or the walnuts. It was like the zucchini wasn't there. My only con would be that there was not enough milk. It was like batter before, so I put in another 1/4 cup. Cooked perfectly, and is DELISH!
Awesome
Very yummy!!! Will definitely make them again!
pretty great!

Made just like the recipe states, and it is excellent. I also added a topping to some of them (butter, brown sugar, rolled oats), and that was also excellent. My kids are (really) picky. They loved them.
My family loved this recipe!! Great recipe! I split the sugar and did half white sugar and half brown sugar. This recipe is a keeper.
Great tasting, easy recipe.

Delicious!! Best muffins Ever!! Used whole wheat flour ( only 1 cup plus 2 TBS), 1/2 c sugar, one TBS cocoa powder per another reviewer, regular sized chocolate chips, baked 25 minutes in convection oven.
Excellent recipe! My 3 year old just CRUSHED one of these, they are so moist and tasty! I swapped out almond milk since I did not have any regular on hand, and omitted the walnuts.
We all loved them, one grandson ate 5 before I could stop him! My husband who doesn’t eat sweets in general at 2.

My fiancé gave these a 10! He had been asking for chocolate chip muffins- I suggested these. He turned his nose up at zucchini. After trying these, he has realized all the stellar reviews are right! I substituted applesauce for half the oil, and reduced the sugar to 1/3 cup like another reviewer suggested. Moist and delicious with just enough sweetness from the chocolate chips and lower amount of sugar. I love the touch of cinnamon and the fact our 3 year old is getting some vegies with her muffins!
